timestamp.description: Timestamp for which the data is requested.

clouds_high.description: High cloud cover @ High cloud layer

clouds_middle.description: Medium cloud cover @ Middle cloud layer

clouds_low.description: Low cloud cover @ Low cloud layer

fog_stability_index.description: Fog Stability Index. FSI < 31 indicates a high probability of fog formation. 31 < FSI < 55 implies moderate risk of fog. FSI > 55 suggests low fog risk. See https://edepot.wur.nl/144635

fog.description: Fogginess (0 is clear, 1 is fully foggy), somewhat arbitrarily computed from FSI.

wind_10m_u.description: u-component of wind at 10 meters height

wind_10m_v.description: v-component of wind at 10 meters height

wind_10m_angle.description: Wind angle at 10 meters height (angle where wind points towards)

wind_20m_u.description: u-component of wind at 20 meters height

wind_20m_v.description: v-component of wind at 20 meters height

wind_20m_angle.description: Wind angle at 20 meters height (angle where wind points towards)

precip_rate.description: Precipitation rate @ Ground or water surface
precip_rate.units: kg.m-2.s-1 (= mm per vierkante meter per seconde)

precip_rain_cat.description: Categorical Rain @ Ground or water surface
precip_rain_cat.units: 0 = No, 1 = Yes. Intermediate values do to interpolation. See https://www.nco.ncep.noaa.gov/pmb/docs/grib2/grib2_doc/grib2_table4-222.shtml

precip_snow_cat.description: Categorical Snow @ Ground or water surface
precip_snow_cat.units: 0 = No, 1 = Yes. Intermediate values do to interpolation. See https://www.nco.ncep.noaa.gov/pmb/docs/grib2/grib2_doc/grib2_table4-222.shtml

precip_freezing_rain_cat.description: Categorical Freezing Rain @ Ground or water surface
precip_freezing_rain_cat.units: 0 = No, 1 = Yes. Intermediate values do to interpolation. See https://www.nco.ncep.noaa.gov/pmb/docs/grib2/grib2_doc/grib2_table4-222.shtml

precip_ice_pellets_cat.description: Categorical Ice Pellets @ Ground or water surface
precip_ice_pellets_cat.units: 0 = No, 1 = Yes. Intermediate values do to interpolation. See https://www.nco.ncep.noaa.gov/pmb/docs/grib2/grib2_doc/grib2_table4-222.shtml

precip_percent_frozen.description: Per cent frozen precipitation @ Ground or water surface

tornadoes.description: Tornado risk computed from storm relative helicity. If higher than 250 J/kg, tornados may develop. See https://www.spc.noaa.gov/exper/mesoanalysis/help/help_srh1.html
tornadoes.units: 0: no tornado risk. 1 risk of tornadoes.

VMDR_WW.description: Mean wind wave direction (angle where wave comes from)

VMDR_SW1.description: Mean primary swell wave direction (angle where wave comes from)

VTM01_SW1.description: Spectral moments (0,1) primary swell wave period

VMDR_SW2.description: Mean secondary swell wave direction (angle where wave comes from)

VTM01_SW2.description: Spectral moments (0,1) secondary swell wave period

VMDR.description: Mean wave direction (angle where wave comes from)

VHM0_SW1.description: Spectral significant primary swell wave height

VHM0_SW2.description: Spectral significant secondary swell wave height

VTPK.description: Wave period at spectral peak / peak period (Tp)

VPED.description: Wave principal direction at spectral peak (angle where the wave is coming from)

VLPK.description: Wavelength of wave at spectral peak

VSPK.description: Speed of wave at spectral peak

VLM0110.description: mean wavelength from variance spectral density

VSM0110.description: mean speed from variance spectral density

VLM01_SW1.description: Spectral moments (0,1) primary swell wave wavelength

VSM01_SW1.description: Spectral moments (0,1) primary swell wave speed

VLM01_SW2.description: Spectral moments (0,1) secondary swell wave wavelength

VSM01_SW2.description: Spectral moments (0,1) secondary swell waved speed

siconc.description: Ice concentration (1: cell is fully covered. 0: cell is ice-free)

chl.description: Total Chlorophyll (proxy for how much biological activity there is)
